meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a machine or machinery.
meanings.sent1: The factory had a mechanistic system for assembling cars.
meanings.sent2: The robot's movements were very mechanistic and precise.
meanings.sent3: The mechanistic way the toy train moved in circles made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: Her dance was so mechanistic, it was as if she was a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent5: The clock's mechanistic ticking filled the room with a sense of order.

meanings.definition: Explaining phenomena in purely physical or deterministic terms.
meanings.sent1: The scientist's mechanistic explanation of the chemical reaction was easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: The book provided a mechanistic view of how the planets move in space.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to hear the mechanistic reasoning behind why cats always land on their feet.
meanings.sent4: Her mechanistic approach to problem-solving was like following a set of instructions.
meanings.sent5: The mechanistic theory of evolution helped students grasp the concept more clearly.

meanings.definition: Involving or emphasizing the importance of mechanical processes.
meanings.sent1: The course focused on the mechanistic aspects of building bridges.
meanings.sent2: The design of the new car engine was highly mechanistic in nature.
meanings.sent3: It was funny to see the mechanistic way the chef prepared the dish, like a robot.
meanings.sent4: The mechanistic nature of the clockwork mechanism fascinated the young engineer.
meanings.sent5: The mechanistic approach to farming increased efficiency and productivity.
